Package ohos.sysappcomponents.settings

Class SystemSettings.Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.sysappcomponents.settings.SystemSettings.Input
  • Enclosing class:
    SystemSettings

    public static class SystemSettings.Input
extends Object
    Provides methods for setting information about input methods, including automatic capitalization, automatic punctuation, autocorrect, password presentation, input method engine, and input method subtypes.
    Since:
    3

    • Field Detail

      • ACTIVATED_INPUT_METHODS

        public static final String ACTIVATED_INPUT_METHODS
        Indicates the list of input methods that have been activated.

        The list is a string that contains the IDs of activated input methods. The IDs are separated by colons (:), and keyboardTypes of an input method are separated by semicolons (;). An example format is ima0:keyboardType0;keyboardType1;ima1:ima2:keyboardTypes0. The type of imaID is ElementName, and the type of keyboard is int.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTIVATED_INPUT_METHOD_SUBMODE

        public static final String ACTIVATED_INPUT_METHOD_SUBMODE
        Indicates the default input method keyboard type and its ID.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUTO_CAPS_TEXT_INPUT

        public static final String AUTO_CAPS_TEXT_INPUT
        Specifies whether automatic capitalization is enabled for the text editor.

        If the value is 0, automatic capitalization is disabled. If the value 1, automatic capitalization is enabled.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUTO_PUNCTUATE_TEXT_INPUT

        public static final String AUTO_PUNCTUATE_TEXT_INPUT
        Specifies whether automatic punctuation is enabled for the text editor. Automatic punctuation enables the text editor to convert two spaces into a period (.) and a space.

        If the value is 0, automatic punctuation is disabled. If the value 1, automatic punctuation is enabled.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • AUTO_REPLACE_TEXT_INPUT

        public static final String AUTO_REPLACE_TEXT_INPUT
        Specifies whether autocorrect is enabled for the text editor. Autocorrect enables the text editor to correct typos.

        If the value is 0, autocorrect is disabled. If the value 1, autocorrect is enabled.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_INPUT_METHOD

        public static final String DEFAULT_INPUT_METHOD
        Indicates the default input method and its ID.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTOR_VISIBILITY_FOR_INPUT_METHOD

        public static final String SELECTOR_VISIBILITY_FOR_INPUT_METHOD
        Specifies whether the input method selector is visible.

        If the value is 1, the input method selector is visible. If the value is 0, the input method selector is invisible.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_PASSWORD_TEXT_INPUT

        public static final String SHOW_PASSWORD_TEXT_INPUT
        Specifies whether password presentation is enabled in the text editor. Password presentation enables the text editor to show password characters when the user types them.

        If the value is 0, password presentation is disabled. If the value 1, password presentation is enabled.

        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
